result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond - MM

03:41 PM Defendant Brandon Li Diaz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for Brandon Li Diaz.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address and date of birth verified,  charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions, No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with K.M.D. or K.J.D unless authorized by CPS if involved. No acts or threats of violence. Adjourned initial appearance November 2, 2022 at 1:00 pm.
